definition: labor/physical work
through road/way out/way to survive/means of subsistence
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: There may be another way, however.
sentences.chinese: 不過，別緊張，也許還有別的活路。

sentences.english: To finish the task, there is no way out.
sentences.chinese: 完不成任務，也就沒了活路。

sentences.english: But we must earn our living all the same.
What will be our future condition if he should beget other suns?
sentences.chinese: 如果他再生幾個小太陽，我們還有活路嗎？

definition: a way to make a living/a way to survive/a way out of a predicament
a way out (lit. and fig.)/opportunity for advancement/a way forward/outlet (for one's products)
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
dead end/(fig.) the road to disaster
(idiom) dead end/road to ruin
impossible to make a living
intact corpse/dead body with no parts missing
margin/leeway
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to leave oneself a way out
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
to hound sb to death
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
